meanings.definition: The quality of being allowed or permitted.
meanings.sent1: The permissibility of eating ice cream before dinner brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent2: I questioned the permissibility of parking in that spot without a permit.
meanings.sent3: The permissibility of wearing pajamas to a fancy dinner party seemed amusing to the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the permissibility that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The permissibility of laughter echoed through the halls.

meanings.sent1: The permissibility of the new rule was met with relief by the employees.
meanings.sent2: We must consider the permissibility of such actions within the company's guidelines.
meanings.sent3: The permissibility of a cat wearing a top hat made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His confidence exuded the permissibility of success.
meanings.sent5: The permissibility of the sun shining through the clouds was a welcome sight.
